note.p: Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, fr. 803
The poem is missing its final verses (the manuscript seems to have lost folios) and breaks off on f. 154v at the line "Et de pluses via/n/des taste" (Lecoy 21531)
Gothic, written in 2 columns of 38 lines, various scribes at work on different quires

1 single-column panel miniature in colors (L'Amans Sleeps), a decorated initial 'M' in colors and gold, and a 2-sided foliate bar border which includes a hybrid creature (f. 1r). 9/14-line spaces left empty for miniatures never completed. Gold initials on pink and blue ground throughout.
308 x 220 mm (this measurement is from Langlois)

French, early 19th century; light brown calf marbled binding with gilt decorative border on upper and lower covers, title of the book and initials of Napoleon in gilt on spine, raised spine bands, marbled endpapers.

Wilhem III of Honstein (1506-1541), early 16th century (a note in Latin on frontmatter.flyleaf.03r reads: "Munus exigui pauperculi parietarii pareciani in Hacheim, prope arcem Moguntinar. Reverendo in Christo patri et domino Wilhelmo ex familia de Honstein prognato, ecclesiae ac diocesis Agentinensis presuli oblato. Anno Virginis partus...millesimo quingentesimo vicesimo."); Jules Mazarin, cardinal and minister of France (1602-1661), 17th century; 18th century stamp of the Bibliotheca Regiae (royal library), where it was ms. 7198 (ff. 1r, 154v)

Also on frontmatter.flyleaf.03r is written "Memoire que le .xxiije. jour du mois de novembre l'an mil .cccc. et sept, le jour de saint Clement, a .x. eures de nuit, [fut tué] a Paris, en la vieille rue du Temple, Mons. le duc. [d'Orleans], frere du roy de Franche, lequel duc avoit non Louise de Vallois, par Roulet d'Ectonville."
1. Paulin Paris, Les manuscrits françois de la Bibliothèque du roi (Paris: Techener, 1836-1848), IV, p. 235
This description has been compiled using the site's images and various published sources. If you have corrections or additional information on the manuscript, please do contact us.
